p: A subset of variables was selected, to reduce collinearity in the dataset of 19 climatic variables. A Pearson correlation matrix was applied to identify pairs or groups of highly-correlated variables ( r > 0.6) and, with one exception, all removals were based on a selection criterion of ecological relevance to the vector. The final set of climate predictors used to run the ecological models consisted of annual mean temperature (BIO1), mean diurnal range of temperature (BIO2), temperature seasonality (BIO4), annual precipitation (BIO12), precipitation seasonality (BIO15) and precipitation of warmest quarter (BIO18) [ 34].
